EMERGENCY NUMBERS — ON CAMPUS 
Fire — Notre Dame Fire Department 6200 
To Report An Emergency 6600 
Or Dial “O” Operator for Assistance 
Give: 1. Location of victim 
2. 
Name of victim 

3. 
Name of calling party 

4. 
Extension number of calling party 

5. 
Facts concerning the emergency

OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR CENTREX 
NOTRE DAME AND ST. MARY'S CAMPUS CALLS: Dial the 4 digit extension number. 
LOCAL CALLS: Dial “9” then the seven digit number. 
CAMPUS DIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: If not listed in directory -Dial “O”. 
ST. MARY’S COLLEGE INFORMATION: Dial “9” — 232-3031. 
LOCAL DIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: Dial “9” -then 113. 
REPAIR AND ASSISTANCE: If your telephone is not working properly, or you need assistance with a call -Dial “O”. 
DIRECTORY CHANGES: Directory changes should be reported as they occur to Personnel Department. Changes include addi­
tions, deletions, number changes, corrections in Directory, etc. 
TO TRANSFER CALLS: 
Incoming calls ONLY may be transferred. Depress the receiver hook1 time and release. The operator will answer and you give her your request. 
WHEN OFF CAMPUS DIALING CAMPUS NUMBERS: 
DialALL seven digits. If you do notknow the num­ber, dial the Notre Dame listed number -283-6011. 
LONG DISTANCE—DIRECT DISTANCE DIALING: 
Dial “9”. Dial "1”. Dial the area code. Then dial the seven digit number.­
STUDENTS: 
GIVE THE OPERATOR YOUR SPECIAL BILLING NUMBER WHEN REQUESTED. 
ADMINISTRATIVE: 
GIVE THE OPERATOR THE NUMBER AS­SIGNED TO YOU WHEN REQUESTED. 
TO REACH THE LONG DISTANCE OPERATOR: 
Dial “9” then “0”. 
CONFERENCE CALLS: 
Conference calls can be placed from any station on campus by dialing “55” for the conference operator. It is possible to have five conferees,on one confer­ence call. 
SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR STUDENTS: 
Long Distance Collect calls incoming are not to be accepted.from any source. A penalty of $5.00 will be assessed by the University for each collect toll call accepted by a student. 
IN MAKING ANY CALL BE SURE TO WAIT FOR THE DIAL TONE. DIAL EACH DIGIT CAREFULLY.

NOTRE DAME -SAINT MARY’S SHUTTLE BUS SCHEDULE 
Fall Semester 1973-74 
LOCAL SERVICE 

Academic Hours: Monday through Friday (8:10 a.m. to 6:00 p.m .) every 15 minutes. 
SHUTTLE SERVICE DURING NON -ACADEMIC HOURS 
Beginning at 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday and all day Saturday and Sunday a 10 cent fee will be charged. The operation of these “fee” buses will be as follows: 
Monday through Thursday — 6:00 p.m. to 12:30 a.m. Friday — 6:00 p.m. to 2:30 a.m. Saturday — 12:00 noon to 2:30 a.m. Sunday — 12:00 noon to12:30 a.m. 
Exact Fares Only W ill Be Accepted 
LOCAL BUS ROUTES 

To Saint Mary’s College: Bear of Nieuwland Science; Power Plant; Li­brary Circle; Bus Shelter; B.O.T.C Building; Grotto and on to Saint Mary’s Campus. 
To Univ. of Notre Dame: Moreau Parking Lot; McCandless Hall; Madel­eva Memorial and on to Notre Dame’s Campus. ND = From N D Campus only. SMC = From SMC Campus only. 
EXPRESS SERVICE 

Express service to insure student transportation to opposite campus in the 15 minutes between classes. 
EXPRESS BUS ROUTES 

To Saint Mary’s College: Departs at the rear of Nieuwland and stops at the Grotto, Madeleva Hall and Moreau Parking Lot (west side of LeMans Hall). 
To Univ. of Notre Dame: Departs from Moreau Parking Lot and stops 
at Madeleva Hall, the Grotto and Nieuwland.

FALL SEMESTER 1973 
Sept. 1-3  Sat. thru Mon.  Orientation & Counselling for new students.  
Sept. 4 Sept. 5 Sept. 9 Sept. 10 Oct. 8 Oct. 18-22  Tuesday Wednesday Sunday Monday Monday Thurs. thru Mon.  Registration for all students. Classes begin at 8:00 a.m. Formal opening of the school year with Concelebrated Mass (Subject to change.) Latest date for all class changes. Columbus Day (classes meet). Midsemester Holiday after the last class.  
Oct. 23 Oct. 26  Tuesday Friday  Classes resume at 8:00 a.m. Midsemester Report of Deficient Students.  
Nov. 1 Nov. 21-25  Thursday W ed. thru Sun.  A ll Saints’ Day (classes meet). Thanksgiving Holiday begins at  
noon.  
Nov. 26 Nov. 29-Dec. 6  Monday Thurs. thru Thurs.  Classes resume at 8:00 a.m. Advance Registration for Spring  
Semester 1973-74.  
Dec. 8 Dec. 15 * Dec. 17-21  Saturday Saturday Mon. thru Fri.  Feast of the Immaculate Conception. Last Class Day.® Final Examinations (Grades due 48 hours after exam is given. No Sunday exams on Dec. 16.)  

®Saturday, December 15 — Monday classes meet.

Orientation for new students. Registration Day. Classes begin at 8:00 a.m. Latest date for all class changes. 
Enrollment reservations for the Fall Semester 1974-75. (Payment of $50.00 fee required.) 
Washington's Birthday (classes meet). Midsemester Reports of Deficient Students. Midsemester vacation begins after last class. 
Classes resume at 8:00 a.m. 
Room reservations for FaH Semester 1974-75. Easter Holiday begins after last class. Classes resume at 8:00 a.m. Advance Registration for the Fall Semester 1974-75 and for the Summer Session 1974. Last class day. Final Examinations. (Grades due 48 hours after exam is given. No Sunday exam on May 12.) Graduating student grades are due. Commencement Weekend.

But that's all changed now, and some other things have changed with it. Things like 7 the pay, free education, travel, and technical train­ing. By the way, the nostal­gia is there too.
